intro: Clerodendrum moramangense, commonly known as the Moramanga clerodendrum, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a rough texture, while the inflorescence consists of clustered flowers. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments within its native habitat.
